programme.title: Nhk Newsline
NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Ama Divers Restoring The Seabed
Ama Divers Restoring the Earthquake-Hit Seabed
programme.desc: In 2024, natural disasters devastated the fishing grounds of the ama (free divers) in Wajima, Noto. We follow their efforts to survey the seabed and revive their tradition.
programme.title: Japan in Focus
programme.sub-title: Ama Divers Restoring the Earthquake-Hit Seabed

programme.title: Newsroom Tokyo
NEWSROOM TOKYO
programme.desc: NEWSROOM TOKYO dives deeper into the day's news with insight and analysis, from the perspective of Japan and the rest of Asia. We put a spotlight on what you need to know to understand the issues.

programme.title: Direct Talk
Direct Talk #202
programme.desc: Yasuda Junichi directed "A Samurai in Time," a playful film made on a shoestring budget that became a word-of-mouth hit. Yasuda, who is also a rice farmer, gives us the behind-the-scenes story.
programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.sub-title: New Life for the Samurai Genre

programme.title: Impacts: Climates Change The World
IMPACTS: Climates Change the World
programme.desc: Global warming is impacting ecosystems and bird habitats in the world's mountainous regions. In the Japanese Alps, various efforts are underway to protect the endangered Japanese rock ptarmigan.
programme.sub-title: Protecting Rock Ptarmigan From Global Warming

programme.title: Ukiyoe Edo-Life(2)
Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: Bustling Scenes of Old Tokyo(2)
programme.desc: The top 3 geisha idol celebrities in Edo: Tomimoto Toyohina, Takashima Ohisa, and Naniwaya Kita. See how Kitagawa Utamaro, the master of female beauty has illustrated them so differently.
programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE
programme.sub-title: Three Beauties of the Present Day by Kitagawa Utamaro
programme.desc: The top 3 female celebrities in Edo: Tomimoto Toyohina, Takashima Ohisa and Naniwaya Kita. See how Utamaro, the master of female beauty has illustrated them so differently.

programme.title: Medical Frontiers
Medical Frontiers
programme.desc: Nuclear medicine therapy involves delivering radiation-emitting drugs directly inside the body to treat refractory cancers. We explore the mechanism of the therapy and the latest developments.

programme.title: Rethinking Human Security/Africa
Rethinking Human Security in Africa
programme.desc: Focuses on the panel discussion at TICAD 9 held in Yokohama, titled "Human Security and Economic Development in Africa: Addressing Multidimensional Challenges and the Future Beyond 2030."
programme.title: Special program
programme.desc: A wide range of topics featuring Japanese culture and society are introduced.

programme.title: Chatroom Japan
Witnesses to Cambodian Genocid
Chatroom Japan
programme.desc: German urbanist Chris Dimmer focuses on the community-building potential of Japan's public bathhouses, or "Sento." He hopes that people living alone can rediscover the value of these bathhouses.
German urbanist Chris Dimmer focuses on the community-building potential of Japans public bathhouses, or Sento. He hopes that people living alone can rediscover the value of these bathhouses.
programme.sub-title: The Local "Sento" - More Than a Bath
programme.desc: Have you ever been to a sento? Christian Dimmer, a German urbanist living in Japan, focuses on the community-building potential of Japan's public bathhouses. It is common these days in our society to live alone or in single-family units. He hopes that people can rediscover the value of the community communication nourished by public bathhouses.
German urbanist Chris Dimmer focuses on the community-building potential of Japan's public bathhouses (sento) - he hopes that people living alone can rediscover the value of these bathhouses.

programme.title: Japan'S Top Inventions
JAPAN'S TOP INVENTIONS
programme.desc: Discover the stories behind renowned Japanese products alongside our reporter. This time: smokeless grills.
programme.title: JAPANS TOP INVENTIONS
programme.desc: Discover the stories behind renowned Japanese products alongside our reporter - this time, smokeless grills.

programme.title: Japanology Plus
Japanology Plus
programme.desc: French journalist and "sento ambassador" Stephanie Crohin promotes sento, or public bathhouses, on social media. She tells Peter Barakan about her love for the heartwarming world of public baths.

The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode focuses on words related to kage, meaning both shadow and shade. From rooting for someone working toward their dreams, to expressing appreciation for those around you, words involving kage are surprisingly common in daily conversation. From his home in Kyoto Prefecture, poet and literary translator Peter MacMillan guides us through such unique words and the culture behind them.

Premium Selections

In September, 11 districts in Yatsuo in Toyama Prefecture parade along different routes performing Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon, a 300-year-old matsuri that features elegant music, dancing, and singing.
Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Adults play the role of the shishi while a...

Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon is a 300-year-old matsuri held in Yatsuo, Toyama Prefecture. Eleven neighborhoods choose their own routes, dances and parade styles, all of which feature elegant music, dancing and singing. Originally a prayer for bountiful harvests and lasting prosperity, it is a community event in which only local people dance and perform. With the threat of COVID-19 receding, the festival went ahead in 2022 for the first time in three years, to the great delight of Yatsuo residents.

programme.title: Bosai:Disaster Response Robots
BOSAI: Science that Can Save Your Life
programme.desc: When disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people trapped under rubble, while fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents may bar entry entirely. That's where disaster response robots can help.
programme.title: BOSAI: Disaster Response Robots
programme.desc: The Great East Japan Earthquake in 2011 and its resulting tsunami caused the accident at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant. The worst nuclear accident in Japan's history suffered from a lack of information due to the inaccessibility of the reactor buildings. For this reason, "disaster response robots" were deployed to take pictures and measure radiation doses inside the buildings.
programme.title: BOSAI: Disaster Response Robots
programme.desc: Disaster Response Robots: If disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people if fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents prevent smooth recovery - that's where robots can help.

When disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people trapped under rubble, while fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear...

The Great East Japan Earthquake in 2011 and its resulting tsunami caused the accident at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant. The worst nuclear accident in Japan's history suffered from a lack of information due to the inaccessibility of the reactor buildings. For this reason, "disaster response robots" were deployed to take pictures and measure radiation doses inside the buildings. In the aftermath of a major disaster like that as well as an earthquake or fire, robots can quickly enter dangerous sites that are inaccessible to humans, find people in need of rescue, and take detailed measurements to provide data about the site. In this episode, we'll look at the latest developments among Japan's "disaster response robots."

programme.desc: The Great East Japan Earthquake in 2011 and its resulting tsunami caused the accident at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant. The Great East Japan Earthquake in 2011 and its resulting tsunami caused the accident at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant. The worst nuclear accident in Japan's history suffered from a lack of information due to the inaccessibility of the reactor buildings. For this reason, "disaster response robots" were deployed to take pictures and measure radiation doses inside the buildings. In the aftermath of a major disaster like that as well as an earthquake or fire, robots can quickly enter dangerous sites that are inaccessible to humans, find people in need of rescue, and take detailed measurements to provide data about the site. In this episode, we'll look at the latest developments among Japan's "disaster response robots."
programme.title: BOSAI: Science that Can Save Your Life
programme.desc: When disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people trapped under rubble, while fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents may bar entry entirely. That's where disaster response robots can help.

Explore the richness and depth of the Japanese language and discover how words and expressions reflect history, culture and the natural world.

The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode focuses on words related to kage, meaning both shadow and shade. From rooting for someone working toward their dreams, to expressing appreciation for those around you, words involving kage are surprisingly common in daily conversation. From his home in Kyoto Prefecture, poet and literary translator Peter MacMillan guides us through such unique words and the culture behind them.

programme.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat Of Japan
MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: In September, 11 districts in Yatsuo, Toyama Prefecture parade along different routes performing Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon, a 300-year-old matsuri that features elegant music, dancing, and singing.
programme.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat of Japan - Season 1, Episode 1
Matsuri: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: In September, 11 districts in Yatsuo in Toyama Prefecture parade along different routes performing Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon, a 300-year-old matsuri that features elegant music, dancing, and singing.
Traditional festivals called matsuri are found all over Japan. In this series, we present diverse matsuri and the preparations leading up to them. Each matsuri presents a new face of local Japan.
In September, 11 districts in Yatsuo in Toyama Prefecture parade along different routes performing Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon, a 300-year-old matsuri that features elegant music, dancing, and singing.

Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon is a 300-year-old matsuri held in Yatsuo, Toyama Prefecture. Eleven neighborhoods choose their own routes, dances and parade styles, all of which feature elegant music, dancing and singing. Originally a prayer for bountiful harvests and lasting prosperity, it is a community event in which only local people dance and perform. With the threat of COVID-19 receding, the festival went ahead in 2022 for the first time in three years, to the great delight of Yatsuo residents.

BOSAI: Science that Can Save Your Life
programme.desc: When disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people trapped under rubble, while fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents may bar entry entirely. That's where disaster response robots can help.
programme.title: Let's Enjoy Maths
programme.desc: Children wish to share a cake but are confused when Numbler cuts the cake into different shapes - Barky uses the basics of fractions and geometry to prove that the pieces are indeed equal.
programme.title: BOSAI: Disaster Response Robots
programme.desc: The Great East Japan Earthquake in 2011 and its resulting tsunami caused the accident at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant. The worst nuclear accident in Japan's history suffered from a lack of information due to the inaccessibility of the reactor buildings. For this reason, "disaster response robots" were deployed to take pictures and measure radiation doses inside the buildings.
programme.title: BOSAI: Disaster Response Robots
programme.desc: Disaster Response Robots: If disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people if fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents prevent smooth recovery - that's where robots can help.

The Great East Japan Earthquake in 2011 and its resulting tsunami caused the accident at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant. The worst nuclear accident in Japan's history suffered from a lack of information due to the inaccessibility of the reactor buildings. For this reason, "disaster response robots" were deployed to take pictures and measure radiation doses inside the buildings. In the aftermath of a major disaster like that as well as an earthquake or fire, robots can quickly enter dangerous sites that are inaccessible to humans, find people in need of rescue, and take detailed measurements to provide data about the site. In this episode, we'll look at the latest developments among Japan's "disaster response robots."
programme.title: BOSAI:Disaster Response Robots

programme.title: BOSAI: Disaster Response Robots
programme.desc: The Great East Japan Earthquake in 2011 and its resulting tsunami caused the accident at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant. The worst nuclear accident in Japan's history suffered from a lack of information due to the inaccessibility of the reactor buildings. For this reason, "disaster response robots" were deployed to take pictures and measure radiation doses inside the buildings.
programme.title: BOSAI: Disaster Response Robots
programme.desc: Disaster Response Robots: If disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people if fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents prevent smooth recovery - that's where robots can help.

The Great East Japan Earthquake in 2011 and its resulting tsunami caused the accident at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant. The worst nuclear accident in Japan's history suffered from a lack of information due to the inaccessibility of the reactor buildings. For this reason, "disaster response robots" were deployed to take pictures and measure radiation doses inside the buildings. In the aftermath of a major disaster like that as well as an earthquake or fire, robots can quickly enter dangerous sites that are inaccessible to humans, find people in need of rescue, and take detailed measurements to provide data about the site. In this episode, we'll look at the latest developments among Japan's "disaster response robots."

The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode focuses on words related to kage, meaning both shadow and shade. From rooting for someone working toward their dreams, to expressing appreciation for those around you, words involving kage are surprisingly common in daily conversation. From his home in Kyoto Prefecture, poet and literary translator Peter MacMillan guides us through such unique words and the culture behind them.

programme.desc: Traditional festivals called matsuri are found all over Japan. In this series, we present diverse matsuri and the preparations leading up to them. Each matsuri presents a new face of local Japan. programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
Matsuri: The Heartbeat of Japan - Season 1, Episode 1
programme.desc: Traditional festivals called matsuri are found all over Japan. In this series, we present diverse matsuri and the preparations leading up to them. Each matsuri presents a new face of local Japan.
In September, 11 districts in Yatsuo in Toyama Prefecture parade along different routes performing Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon, a 300-year-old matsuri that features elegant music, dancing, and singing.

Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon is a 300-year-old matsuri held in Yatsuo, Toyama Prefecture. Eleven neighborhoods choose their own routes, dances and parade styles, all of which feature elegant music, dancing and singing. Originally a prayer for bountiful harvests and lasting prosperity, it is a community event in which only local people dance and perform. With the threat of COVID-19 receding, the festival went ahead in 2022 for the first time in three years, to the great delight of Yatsuo residents.

Today: pointing out a senior coworker's mistake. Kyaw Swar Aung, from Myanmar, works behind the scenes at Narita Airport. He carries out tasks such as guiding aircraft as well as loading and unloading baggage. He's learned that both caution and precision are necessary to prevent accidents. programme.title: Zero Waste Life
Zero Waste Life
programme.desc: Meet people around Japan who strive for a life without waste under the traditional philosophy of "MOTTAINAI," which values cherishing the things we have.
Okinawa is home to "Ryukyu Glass," a local industry for over 100 years. Matsumoto Sakae uses discarded bottles to make things to be loved and never again thrown away, doing his part to reduce waste.

Okinawa is home to 'Ryukyu Glass', a local industry for over 100 years. Matsumoto Sakae uses discarded bottles to make things to be loved and never again thrown away, doing his part to reduce waste.

The Japanese southern island of Okinawa Prefecture, warm all year, this popular tourist spot is home to "Ryukyu Glass," a local industry for over 100 years. Glass blower Matsumoto Sakae insists on using discarded bottles as raw material. He says their status as trash inspires him to give them beauty, making things that will be loved and never again thrown away. Hoping, in some small way, to reduce waste in the world, he keeps his furnace hot and his tools ready.

programme.title: A Cat'S-Eye View Of Japan
A Cat's-Eye View of Japan
programme.desc: On this unique trip around Japan, discover the lesser-known charms and customs of regions through the eyes of cats! Filmed by wildlife photographe,Iwago Mitsuaki.

Globe-trotting wildlife photographer and filmmaker, Iwago Mitsuaki, offers the best of a vast collection of cat footage he took in Japan. On this unique trip around the country, discover the lesser-known charms and customs of regions through the eyes of cats! Tokyo is home to many lucky cats called "maneki-neko!" Get your kitty fix at a public bath, a lantern shop, and a classical theater. Then, meet them after hours in Shinjuku's Golden Gai bar district!
Photographer Iwago Mitsuaki reunites with cats from his past! He meets Kurobe, a temple cat, for the first time in six years. He then visits a seaside town to see Ponzu for the first time in twelve.

Pointing Out A Senior Co-Worker's Mistake: Kyaw Swar Aung from Myanmar works behind the scenes at Narita Airport - he tackles a role play challenge in which he notices a senior worker's mistake.

Today: pointing out a senior coworker's mistake. Kyaw Swar Aung, from Myanmar, works behind the scenes at Narita Airport. He carries out tasks such as guiding aircraft as well as loading and unloading baggage. He's learned that both caution and precision are necessary to prevent accidents. He knows to report anything out of the ordinary, as well as any errors. He'll tackle a roleplay challenge in which he notices a senior worker's mistake. How will he handle the situation?

programme.title: Zero Waste Life
Zero Waste Life
programme.desc: Meet people around Japan who strive for a life without waste under the traditional philosophy of "MOTTAINAI," which values cherishing the things we have.
Okinawa is home to "Ryukyu Glass," a local industry for over 100 years. Matsumoto Sakae uses discarded bottles to make things to be loved and never again thrown away, doing his part to reduce waste.

Okinawa is home to 'Ryukyu Glass', a local industry for over 100 years. Matsumoto Sakae uses discarded bottles to make things to be loved and never again thrown away, doing his part to reduce waste.

The Japanese southern island of Okinawa Prefecture, warm all year, this popular tourist spot is home to "Ryukyu Glass," a local industry for over 100 years. Glass blower Matsumoto Sakae insists on using discarded bottles as raw material. He says their status as trash inspires him to give them beauty, making things that will be loved and never again thrown away. Hoping, in some small way, to reduce waste in the world, he keeps his furnace hot and his tools ready.

programme.title: A Cat'S-Eye View Of Japan
A Cat's-Eye View of Japan
programme.desc: On this unique trip around Japan, discover the lesser-known charms and customs of regions through the eyes of cats! Filmed by wildlife photographe,Iwago Mitsuaki.

Globe-trotting wildlife photographer and filmmaker, Iwago Mitsuaki, offers the best of a vast collection of cat footage he took in Japan. On this unique trip around the country, discover the lesser-known charms and customs of regions through the eyes of cats! Tokyo is home to many lucky cats called "maneki-neko!" Get your kitty fix at a public bath, a lantern shop, and a classical theater. Then, meet them after hours in Shinjuku's Golden Gai bar district!
Photographer Iwago Mitsuaki reunites with cats from his past! He meets Kurobe, a temple cat, for the first time in six years. He then visits a seaside town to see Ponzu for the first time in twelve.

programme.title: Ukiyoe Edo-life
programme.desc: Centuries ago, Tokyo was known as EDO. More than a million people enjoyed life in this city, they live on in ukiyo-e woodblock prints. Take a deep dive into ukiyo-e and explore the soul of old Tokyo.

programme.title: Documentary 360
Laugh Then Think: Japan's Offbeat Science
programme.desc: Electrified spoons can make food taste salty, aiding people on special diets. Miyashita Homei uses this technology to recreate a variety of flavors that might reshape the future of food.
programme.title: Laugh Then Think:Japan's Offbeat Science
Unsolved Cases
programme.desc: North Korean agents abducted at least 17 Japanese citizens around the late 1970's. Only 5 returned. We interviewed over 100 former investigators and others to uncover why the case remains unresolved.
Miyashita Homei discusses his invention, an electrified spoon that imparts a salty taste to foods. This technology is designed to help those on special diets by satisfying their palates.
programme.title: Laugh Then Think
programme.desc: Japan boasts a deep roster of Ig Nobel Prize winners, fostered by a research culture that embraces unconventional thinkers. Meet the offbeat scientists whose research makes you laugh ... then think.

He carries out tasks such as guiding aircraft as well as loading and unloading baggage. He's learned that both caution and precision are necessary to prevent accidents. programme.title: Zero Waste Life
programme.desc: Meet people around Japan who strive for a life without waste under the traditional philosophy of "MOTTAINAI," which values cherishing the things we have.
Okinawa is home to "Ryukyu Glass," a local industry for over 100 years. Matsumoto Sakae uses discarded bottles to make things to be loved and never again thrown away, doing his part to reduce waste.

programme.title: Zero Waste Life
programme.desc: Okinawa is home to 'Ryukyu Glass', a local industry for over 100 years. Matsumoto Sakae uses discarded bottles to make things to be loved and never again thrown away, doing his part to reduce waste.

The Japanese southern island of Okinawa Prefecture, warm all year, this popular tourist spot is home to "Ryukyu Glass," a local industry for over 100 years. Glass blower Matsumoto Sakae insists on using discarded bottles as raw material. He says their status as trash inspires him to give them beauty, making things that will be loved and never again thrown away. Hoping, in some small way, to reduce waste in the world, he keeps his furnace hot and his tools ready.

programme.title: A Cat's-Eye View of Japan
programme.desc: Globe-trotting wildlife photographer and filmmaker, Iwago Mitsuaki, offers the best of a vast collection of cat footage he took in Japan. On this unique trip around the country, discover the lesser-known charms and customs of regions through the eyes of cats! Tokyo is home to many lucky cats called "maneki-neko!" Get your kitty fix at a public bath, a lantern shop, and a classical theater. Then, meet them after hours in Shinjuku's Golden Gai bar district!
On this unique trip around Japan, discover the lesser-known charms and customs of regions through the eyes of cats! Filmed by wildlife photographe,Iwago Mitsuaki.
Photographer Iwago Mitsuaki reunites with cats from his past! He meets Kurobe, a temple cat, for the first time in six years. He then visits a seaside town to see Ponzu for the first time in twelve.

The Japanese southern island of Okinawa Prefecture, warm all year, this popular tourist spot is home to "Ryukyu Glass," a local industry for over 100 years. Glass blower Matsumoto Sakae insists on using discarded bottles as raw material. He says their status as trash inspires him to give them beauty, making things that will be loved and never again thrown away. Hoping, in some small way, to reduce waste in the world, he keeps his furnace hot and his tools ready.

programme.title: BOSAI: Science that Can Save Your Life
programme.desc: Japan has a long history of natural disasters. BOSAI explores how to overcome them and save lives with the power of science. When disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people trapped under rubble, while fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents may bar entry entirely. That's where disaster response robots can help.
When disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people trapped under rubble, while fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents may bar entry entirely. That's where disaster response robots can help.
programme.title: BOSAI
programme.desc: The Great East Japan Earthquake in 2011 and its resulting tsunami caused the accident at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant. The worst nuclear accident in Japan's history suffered from a lack of information due to the inaccessibility of the reactor buildings. For this reason, "disaster response robots" were deployed to take pictures and measure radiation doses inside the buildings. In the aftermath of a major disaster like that as well as an earthquake or fire, robots can quickly enter dangerous sites that are inaccessible to humans, find people in need of rescue, and take detailed measurements to provide data about the site. In this episode, we'll look at the latest developments among Japan's "disaster response robots."

programme.desc: The Manyoshu is the oldest extant anthology of Japanese poetry. Through poems presented in both manga and modern settings, we glimpse sentiments from centuries ago. Peter MacMillan, a poet and a literary translator, presents various Japanese words and expressions related to mud.

The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode focuses on words related to doro, or mud. Since ancient times, Japanese people have gotten muddy in the rice paddies, cultivating their main staple. Perhaps because of this, there are a surprising number of expressions related to mud in Japanese. And reflecting such a place of hard work, many of them are used in business situations. From his home in Kyoto Prefecture, poet and literary translator Peter MacMillan guides us through unique words born from "mud."

programme.title: BIZ STREAM
Seasoning The Seasons
programme.desc: Beautiful Japan. Explore the four seasons across Japan, through its long history, ancient traditions, local festivals, food and daily life. This program visits places across Japan to introduce the charms of their local daily life and festivals fostered by the nation's long history.
This program visits places across Japan to introduce the charms of their local daily life and festivals fostered by the nation's long history.

Visiting different places across Japan to introduce the viewer to the charms of local daily life and festivals fostered by the nation's long history. This time, highlighting the history behind Japan's bridges.

Traveling across Japan, we can find many bridges of all shapes and sizes. In Tokyo, building modern bridges was one way to join the club of advanced industrial nations in the late 19th century, when Japan was vying to catch up with Western technology. A small bridge in Iwate Prefecture is hand-made. Even if relatively few people use it, it is an important crossing for the local community. Today, we hear the story of bridges linking communities throughout Japan.

programme.title: Herbal Symphony #3 Autumn
MATSURI
programme.desc: Traditional festivals called matsuri are found all over Japan. In this series, we present diverse matsuri and the preparations leading up to them. Each matsuri presents a new face of local Japan. Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Adults play the role of the shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects.
programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Adults play the role of the shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects.

Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Here, the shishi symbolizes the harshness and bounty of the natural world, and the matsuri focuses on the importance of harmony between people and nature. Adults play the role of the enormous shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects. This event is also an opportunity for local families to wish for happy marriages and children, and the shishi dances in celebration.

programme.title: On the Wings
programme.desc: Join us on a night flight to admire Japan's stunning views on a journey from Tokyo to Fukuoka. Behold the sublime beauty of Mt. Fuji at sunset and the sparkling night views of major cities.

programme.title: Let's enjoy Math with Barky the Dog
programme.desc: Children wish to share a cake, but are confused when Numbler cuts the cake into different shapes. Barky uses the basics of fractions and geometry to prove that the pieces are indeed equal.

programme.title: TAKE TECH
programme.desc: TAKE TECH is an educational program for children from upper elementary school to high school designed to foster familiarity with everyday technology. The focus is technology we depend on in our daily lives, such as products found in people's homes, information systems and machines. Why were they created, and how do they work? Each episode features one key tech and explains its mechanism and function in an easy-to-understand way.

programme.desc: ▽高市首相の首脳外交が本格スタート・日米首脳会談▽相次ぐクマの被害・死者数が過去最多▽10月28日は「パンダの日」【キャスター 小野寺善子 板鼻英二】

programme.title: ワンワンわんだーらんど 大阪公演[字][再]
programme.desc: 大阪からワンダホー！▽ワンワンの大阪のおともだちが遊びにきて“ダンシング玉入れ”で勝負するよ！▽「どーぞん」「虫のおんがくたい」など、うたとダンスもお楽しみに！

programme.title: すくすく子育て どうする？ひとりっ子の子育て[字]
programme.desc: ひとりっ子は甘えんぼう？社会性が育ちにくい？協調性が身に付きにくい？ひとりっ子を子育て中の全国のママパパのお悩みに専門家がアドバイス！丸山桂里奈 りんたろー。

programme.title: こころの時代 ヴィクトール・フランクル （1）「日曜生まれの子」その光と影[字][再]
programme.desc: 「どんなに苦しい状況に陥っても、生きることには意味がある」。ナチス・ドイツの強制収容所を生き延びた精神科医ヴィクトール・フランクルの思想と人生にシリーズで迫る。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 伝説のマエストロ カラヤンの日本公演再び[字]
programme.desc: 「帝王」カラヤンによる1957年のベルリン・フィル初来日公演と1959年、ウィーン・フィルとの日本での唯一の共演を鮮明なリマスター映像で！

programme.title: 第103回全国学生相撲選手権[字]
programme.desc: 学生相撲の頂点が決まる！個人戦の模様をベスト16から生中継。過去には横綱・大の里も優勝したこの大会で今年は誰が活躍を見せるのか？ 解説：勝田晃三

programme.title: おかあさんといっしょ ファミリーコンサート 新潟[字]

programme.title: アニメ きかんしゃトーマス 名作セレクション「パーシーとゆうめいながか」ほか[二][字]
programme.desc: イギリスで原作絵本が出版されてから80年、日本でのテレビ放送開始から35年。長年にわたって親しまれている「きかんしゃトーマス」の、往年の名作エピソードを放送。

programme.title: アニメ ふしぎ駄菓子屋 銭天堂「迫りくる危機」[字]
programme.desc: 幸運な人だけがたどりつける、ふしぎな駄菓子屋「銭天堂」。店主の紅子がすすめる駄菓子は、幸福を呼ぶか？不幸をまねくか？銭天堂、開店！本日の幸運のお客様は……。

programme.title: アニメ スポンジ・ボブ「キュートなQTパイ」「郵便配達は大変だ」[二][字]
programme.desc: 深い海の底にある海底都市・ビキニタウンに住むスポンジ・ボブとその仲間たちが繰り広げる、ユーモラスで楽しい日常を描いたハイテンション・アニメ！

programme.title: ミニアニメ チキップダンサーズ「くっつけぺたぺた」
programme.desc: つむぎちゃんのマグカップがこわれちゃった！だんごたちが接着剤でくっつけて修理をしてあげます。次の日、部屋のかべに色々なものが貼りついていて…だれのいたずら？

programme.title: 地球ドラマチック 小さなセンザンコウ〜コーシャが教えてくれたこと〜[二][字]
programme.desc: 密猟から救われたセンザンコウの赤ちゃんコーシャ。漢方薬の材料としてうろこを狙われる中、保護団体の人々に育まれ、ついに、野生で母になる。人と動物との感動の記録。

programme.desc: 世間の「相棒」事情を調査！ぬいぐるみが「相棒」だという人たちの“ぬい活”現場に潜入取材！そして子どもたちに大人気！手作りおじさんカードの秘密に迫ります。

programme.title: 絶対行きたくなる!ニッポン不滅の名城 松江城[字][再]
programme.desc: 日本の城の魅力を、最新の研究成果とともに紹介する人気シリーズの新作。今回は島根県の松江城。現存する国宝天守に隠された数々の謎とは?城のミステリーを解き明かす!
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: Road to Milano Cortina 2026「フィギュアスケート女子」
programme.desc: ミラノ・コルティナ2026オリンピックのシーズンが始まる。フィギュアスケート女子のエース坂本花織は、今季限りで一線を退く意向を表明。ラストシーズンに臨む。

programme.title: 驚き!地球!グレートネイチャー 壮観!黄金文明の大地 〜ブルガリア〜[解][字][再]
programme.desc: 絶景あふれる東欧・ブルガリア。威容を放つ白亜の大山塊、“神の目”から光注ぐ洞窟、黄金色に輝く山肌…。そして、太古の大地殻変動は、この地に黄金文明をもたらした!?
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: Road to Milano Cortina 2026「フィギュアスケート男子」
programme.desc: ミラノ・コルティナ2026オリンピックのシーズン到来。フィギュアスケート男子・鍵山優真は前回オリンピックで銀メダル。ミラノでは、日本のエースとして頂点を目指す。

programme.title: 驚き!ニッポンの底力「鉄道王国物語9 新幹線スペシャル」[字][再]
programme.desc: 新幹線を大特集!秘密の試験車両「J0編成」の最新技術を初の単独取材!驚きの自動運転技術、ドクターイエローを上回る自動検査技術を発見!進化する新幹線に迫る
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 第67回NHK杯ジャンプ[字]
programme.desc: 晩秋の札幌・大倉山に日本の男女トップ選手が集結。男子はオリンピック金メダリストの小林陵侑が4年ぶりに、女子は高梨沙羅・伊藤有希・勢藤優花・丸山希が出場します。

programme.title: 釣りびと万歳 海底スレスレをキープせよ!褐色のオキメバル〜川村卓也 新潟〜[字]
programme.desc: 新潟の海でオキメバルを狙う。この魚、目の前にエサを漂わせなければ釣ることはできない。しかし、船は絶えず移動するため釣り上げるのは至難の技。果たして釣果はいかに。

programme.title: べらぼう〜蔦重栄華乃夢噺〜(42)招かれざる客[解][字]
programme.desc: 身上半減から店を立て直した蔦重(横浜流星)は、てい(橋本愛)の懐妊を知り、子どもの誕生を心待ちにする。一方、城中では定信(井上祐貴)が幕閣内で孤立し始めていた。

programme.title: 【BS時代劇・選】小吉の女房2(2)「小吉、腹を切る?」[解][字]
programme.desc: 小吉とお信は、大身旗本・岡野を助けるため騒動に巻き込まれる。小吉は岡野家の知行所である摂津の農村まで出向き、金を作ろうと算段するが、大苦戦…小吉、腹を切る?!

programme.title: 新・BS日本のうた 選▽美川・天童・細川の魅力に迫る熱唱&楽しいステージ![字]
programme.desc: 後輩歌手から美川・天童・細川へ「〇〇なんでだろう?」と質問。歌の秘訣や魅力を伝授!?テツandトモと笑いあり熱唱あり!▽2023年4月23日に放送した回の再放送

programme.title: ワースポ×MLBサンデー▽ワールドシリーズ第7戦ドジャース連覇なるか?
programme.desc: WS制覇はどちらだ?球団初の連覇を狙うドジャースか、32年ぶりの優勝にかけるブルージェイズか?すべての力をぶつけ合う両チーム、運命の第7戦をたっぷりお伝えする。

programme.title: 絶景!ヨーロッパの山小屋めぐり 冬山遊びを楽しめる山小屋
programme.desc: ヨーロッパにあるたくさんの山小屋の魅力を15分でお届け。アイスクライミングなどの冬の雪山遊びを楽しめて笑顔いっぱいになれるイタリア北部の山小屋を紹介する。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: ドラマ 終活シェアハウス(3)[字]
programme.desc: 南米帰りの元書籍編集者・沼袋豪(石坂浩二)が、旧知の歌子(竹下景子)を訪ねてやってくる。彼のユニークな人生観が、翔太(城桧吏)や美果(畑芽育)にも影響を及ぼす。

programme.title: 夜ドラ「コトコト〜おいしい心と出会う旅〜」PR 富山編&新潟編
programme.desc: 夜ドラ「コトコト〜おいしい心と出会う旅〜富山編&新潟編」が帰ってきた!“グルメ人情物語”の見どころを紹介。主人公の百貨店バイヤーを演じるのは、古川雄大さん!

programme.title: 阿修羅のごとく PR
programme.desc: 4人姉妹を主人公に、脚本家・向田邦子が、女心の奥底に潜む阿修羅のようなエゴや執念をえぐり出した、辛口ドラマ。魅力を1分でお届けします。

programme.title: 蔦屋重三郎の世界 婦女人相十品 ポッピンを吹く娘[字]
programme.desc: 江戸時代の出版プロデューサー蔦屋重三郎が世に出した浮世絵「ポッピンを吹く娘」を3DCGで鑑賞。当時最先端のファッションを伝える歌麿の美人画を堪能する
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: The Covers 秋の夜長のバラードナイト〜第1夜〜[字]
programme.desc: MC:リリー・フランキー上白石萌歌/氷川きよしが3年ぶりに登場!新生KIINA.の音楽原点・工藤静香&globeの名バラードをカバー!静香&小室哲哉への思い語る

programme.title: Jリーグタイム「J2スペシャル」
programme.desc: 日曜夜11時20分▼J2スペシャル第35節のゴールをお届け▼今井美桜キャスター好調V・ファーレン長崎に行ってみお!▼宮澤ミシェル“ここがトレビア〜ン”解説

programme.title: チョイ住みinメルボルン 俳優・井上祐貴×元ボクシング世界王者・長谷川穂積[字][再]
programme.desc: 第20弾となる今回の舞台はオーストラリアで最もヨーロッパの雰囲気が残るメルボルン。英経済誌で「世界で最も住みやすい都市」にも認定された町での「チョイ住み」とは?

programme.title: 絶景YOGA 小笠原 父島[SS]
programme.desc: 就寝前のひととき。南国の絶景を見ながら、ヨガで心身の緊張を解きほぐしませんか。海のさざ波や浜風の音、木々のざわめきや虫の鳴き声が、あなたの部屋を包み込みます。

programme.title: 運転席からの風景 JR鶴見線
programme.desc: 京浜工業地帯を走り、人とモノを運ぶ路線として、日本の経済発展を支えてきたJR鶴見線。沿線にはユニークな駅も多い。鶴見線の魅力を運転席からの風景で伝える。

programme.title: 地球でイチバンの野生動物の楽園「アフリカ編〜タンザニア〜」
programme.desc: 紀行番組「地球イチバン」の特選映像。アフリカ編は野生動物の楽園セレンゲティの風景。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 大空撮!ヒマラヤ山脈「白い山 ダウラギリ」
programme.desc: 山岳用の特別な小型機を使って8000m峰が連なるヒマラヤ山脈を上空から撮影した。標高800mのポカラからダウラギリへ。さらに麓から標高差6000mの世界を仰ぐ。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: BSスペシャル 消えた家族を捜して 〜地中海 難民危機の10年〜[字]
programme.desc: 紛争や迫害を逃れるため地中海をわたりヨーロッパを目指す難民。多くが海の上で命を落とし、いまもほとんどの遺体が見つかっていない。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: にっぽん縦断 こころ旅 ゴール! 1325日目 山形県1日目[字][再]
programme.desc: 2025秋の旅!田中美佐子さんが自転車で全国を走ります!月〜木曜は、「朝版」とお昼の「ゴール!」を合わせて見れば1日の旅が完結です! この日は、山形県酒田市へ!
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.desc: 2025秋の旅!田中美佐子さんが自転車で全国を走ります! 月〜木曜は「朝版」とお昼の「ゴール!」を合わせて見れば1日の旅が完結です! この日は、山形県鶴岡市へ!

programme.desc: 2025秋の旅!田中美佐子さんが自転車で全国を走ります! 月〜木曜は「朝版」とお昼の「ゴール!」を合わせて1日の旅が完結です! この日は、山形県鶴岡市覚岸寺へ!

programme.title: にっぽん縦断 こころ旅 ゴール! 1328日目 山形県4日目[字][再]
programme.desc: 2025秋の旅!田中美佐子さんが自転車で全国を走ります! 月〜木曜は「朝版」とお昼の「ゴール!」を合わせて見れば1日の旅が完結です! この日は、山形県河北町へ!
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 夜ドラ「コトコト〜おいしい心と出会う旅〜」PR 富山編&新潟編
programme.desc: 夜ドラ「コトコト〜おいしい心と出会う旅〜富山編&新潟編」が帰ってきた!“グルメ人情物語”の見どころを紹介。主人公の百貨店バイヤーを演じるのは、古川雄大さん!

programme.title: 大河ドラマ「べらぼう」ダイジェスト(41)歌麿筆美人大首絵[字]
programme.desc: 主演・横浜流星。大河ドラマ「べらぼう〜蔦重栄華乃夢噺〜」各話の気になる場面を2分に凝縮、もう一度プレイバック!各話の貴重なオフショットも公開!作・森下佳子。

programme.title: 走れ!新幹線(3)「車両アラカルト E1系〜E7系・W7系」
programme.desc: 0系を始め、進化した新幹線車両。そのうち英数字で表されたE1系からE7系・W7系の走行映像でつづる30分。長年にわたり撮影された膨大な映像から珠玉カットを厳選。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 走れ!新幹線(4)「空から見た新幹線」
programme.desc: 懐かしの0系から進化してきた新幹線。500系、E1系などが疾走する様子を空撮映像でつづる30分。50年にわたって撮影された膨大な映像から珠玉のカットを厳選。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 運転席からの風景 近鉄奈良線
programme.desc: 大阪から奈良への観光路線でもある近鉄奈良線。 車窓から大阪平野を望み、生駒トンネルを抜けて世界文化遺産に登録された古都へ。

programme.title: 空の島旅 南から西から
programme.desc: 豊かな自然と深い歴史に育まれた小さな島々の絶景をドローン映像を中心に紹介する。今回は南国沖縄県の奥武島から北へ東へ。最後は四国徳島県の出羽島まで13の島を巡る。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 空からクルージング特別編「ヨーロッパの城と宮殿」
programme.desc: 世界各地の絶景の中を空からゆったりと旅をする紀行番組「空からクルージング」。8Kで撮影した美しい映像の中からヨーロッパ各国の城と宮殿を紹介する。

programme.title: にっぽんカラフル「異界」[字]
programme.desc: なつかしい音楽と一緒に、なつかしい日本へ旅しませんか。今回は、恐ろしいもの、あやしいもの、ありがたいものがうごめく不思議の世界へ(「新日本風土記」関連番組)
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 中井精也の絶景!てつたび 晩秋の福岡 未来へつなぐ道[字][再]
programme.desc: ローカル鉄道の魅力を再発見する「絶景!てつたび」。今回は晩秋の福岡県が舞台。鉄道写真家の中井精也さんが存続・再生に奮闘する路線の沿線を旅情豊かに撮影していく。

programme.title: 【連続テレビ小説】どんど晴れ(18)「おもてなしの心」[解][字]
programme.desc: 盛岡での仲居修業をはじめた夏美は、失敗を重ねながらも持ち前の明るさで仕事を覚えていく。しかし、夏美の不手際が原因で客が怪我をしてしまい、夏美は窮地に立たされる。

programme.title: 美の壺「天空の聖地 高野山」[字][再]
programme.desc: 空海が開いた真言密教の聖地・高野山。「曼荼羅(まんだら)」の美、手仕事が生み出す「数珠(じゅず)」、「宿坊」の精進料理など高野山の美と魅力をご紹介!

programme.title: 空旅中国 悠久の大地を飛ぶ 雪の東北平原[字]
programme.desc: 舞台は中国の北の端、黒竜江省。冬には氷点下20度を下回る極寒の大地をドローンで大飛行。中国屈指の大慶油田、タンチョウの越冬地ジャロン湿地など雄大な景色を味わう。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 【連続テレビ小説】ばけばけ第5週 ワタシ、ヘブン。マツエ、モ、ヘブン。21[解][字][再]
programme.desc: 銀二郎(寛一郎)との別れから4年。トキ(高石あかり)はいまだ貧乏借金暮らしから抜け出せずにいた。そんな中、松江に外国人英語教師が来ることを知り、見物に向かう。

programme.title: 【連続テレビ小説】ばけばけ第5週 ワタシ、ヘブン。マツエ、モ、ヘブン。22[解][字][再]
programme.desc: アメリカから英語教師レフカダ・ヘブン(トミー・バストウ)が松江に上陸した。通訳を任された錦織(吉沢亮)だが、日本に興味津々で暴走するヘブンに振り回される。

programme.title: 【連続テレビ小説】ばけばけ第5週 ワタシ、ヘブン。マツエ、モ、ヘブン。23[解][字][再]
programme.desc: 神々の国の首都・松江で迎えた朝景色にヘブン(トミー・バストウ)は感動を覚える。一方、トキ(高石あかり)はなみ(さとうほなみ)から、ヘブンにお使いを頼まれる。

programme.title: 【連続テレビ小説】ばけばけ第5週 ワタシ、ヘブン。マツエ、モ、ヘブン。24[解][字][再]
programme.desc: しじみ売りに花田旅館を訪れるトキ(高石あかり)は、平太(生瀬勝久)やツル(池谷のぶえ)、ウメ(野内まる)と共に、ヘブン(トミー・バストウ)と交流を深めていた。

programme.title: 【連続テレビ小説】ばけばけ第5週 ワタシ、ヘブン。マツエ、モ、ヘブン。25[解][字][再]
programme.desc: 突如、部屋から出てこなくなったヘブン(トミー・バストウ)。学校に連れ出そうと駆けつけた錦織(吉沢亮)を見たトキは、ふとその後を追いかける。

programme.title: ワイルドライフ オーストラリア南東部の海 奇想天外!タコ知られざる求愛戦略[解][字][再]
programme.desc: タコのオスがメスに貝をプレゼント。そして、必死に何度もプロポーズを繰り返すいちずなオスの感動のドラマ!世界中の海で大繁栄するタコの多様な求愛戦略を解き明かす。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: “神秘の滝”に挑む[字][再]
programme.desc: 霊峰・白山の中腹にある、百四丈滝(ひゃくよじょうのたき)。冬、巨大な氷のつぼが現れ、神秘的な光景が広がる。門田ギハードが、氷と岩のミックスクライミングに挑んだ。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 世界熱中ひとり旅 石田ゆり子×イギリス 犬と猫を抱きしめる[解][字][再]
programme.desc: 大の動物好きとして知られる俳優・石田ゆり子さんが、憧れの“ペット先進国”イギリスを訪問。愛らしい犬や猫とふれあいながら、豊かな動物愛護文化を体感しました!
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 六角精児の呑み鉄本線・日本旅 秋・豊肥本線、南阿蘇鉄道を呑む![字][再]
programme.desc: 俳優・六角精児が「酒」と「鉄道」という偏った視点で旅する▽秋の九州、JR豊肥本線と南阿蘇鉄道の旅▽大分から熊本にかけて、名水が生み出す美酒との出会い▽語り・壇蜜

programme.title: シネマ「犬部!」<レターボックスサイズ>[字]
programme.desc: 林遣都、中川大志共演。青森の大学に実在したサークルをモデルに、動物たちのために奔走する獣医学生たちの奮闘の日々と、卒業後の学生たちの絆と葛藤を描く青春ドラマ。

programme.title: にっぽん百名山ミニ 3min「秋 鳳凰山」[字]
programme.desc: 南アルプスの鳳凰山(2840m観音岳)、ニホンカモシカがすむ紅葉の森を歩き、地蔵ヶ岳の山頂部“オベリスク”へ!高さ26mの白い花崗岩の塔は鳳凰三山のシンボルだ!
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 犬のおしごと「セラピー犬」[字]
programme.desc: 世界には人と一緒に働く犬がたくさんいる。オーストラリアで出会ったのは、救命救急病棟で医師や看護師たちのストレスを和らげるセラピー犬。その癒しのテクニックに密着。

programme.title: コウケンテツの日本100年ゴハン紀行ミニ 島根・松江のサバの塩辛編[字]
programme.desc: 料理研究家コウケンテツが、100年先まで残したい日本の食を探す旅。島根県・松江市で、サバが大好きな島根県ならではの発酵食品、サバの塩辛を味わう。

programme.title: フロンティア 線状降水帯 発生を予測できるのか?〜気象学者たちの闘い〜[解][字][再]
programme.desc: 日本列島を襲う「線状降水帯」はいつどうやって発生するのか?その予測は今なお困難を極める。発生のメカニズムを解明すべく現場で観測を続ける気象学者たちの挑戦を追う。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 刑事コロンボ(25)「権力の墓穴」[二][字]
programme.desc: 何度見ても新しい!ミステリードラマの金字塔。コロンボの上司が犯人という大胆な設定!クライマックスに向かう1シーンにコロンボが犯行を暴く見事な伏線が隠されている。

programme.title: 大人のわがまま旅〜大好きなあの街で3日間〜 inリスボン[字]
programme.desc: 「大人だって、わがままに旅したい!」誰もが憧れる海外の地で3日間、わがままがギュっと詰まった濃密な旅の体験をお届け。俳優・前田公輝がポルトガル・リスボンへ

programme.title: トットちゃんの宝物 2[字]
programme.desc: 黒柳徹子さんはモノが捨てられない人。自宅には親しかった人からのプレゼントでいっぱい。宝物一つ一つに秘められた徹子さんとスターたちの感動エピソードをたっぷり紹介!
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 体感!グレートネイチャー 爆裂火山列カスケード!〜北米・知られざる絶景の宝庫[解][字]
programme.desc: 26本の氷河を抱える巨大山塊…クジラの背中…雷を呼ぶ山…そして、謎の“水平火山”…北米・絶景火山列千キロを踏破!多彩な奇観を生み出した地中マグマの神秘に迫る!
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: ワースポ×MLB▽決着かタイか…運命の第6戦
programme.desc: 32年ぶりWS制覇へ王手のブルージェイズが決めるのか?エース山本由伸が先発するドジャースがタイに持ち込むのか?運命の第6戦を詳報!大谷翔平・佐々木朗希の活躍は?

programme.title: ドラマ 終活シェアハウス(2)[字][再]
programme.desc: 瞬く間に歌子(竹下景子)たちのペースに巻き込まれて“カメハウズ”の秘書となった翔太(城桧吏)だったが、ガールフレンドの美果(畑芽育)はその状況が気に食わなくて…

programme.title: [4K]バイエルン国立歌劇場「ニーベルングの指環」（１９８９年） ワルキューレ
programme.desc: オペラの金字塔「ニーベルングの指環」。歴史的映像の４Ｋレストア版を４夜連続で！指揮：サヴァリッシュ 演出：ニコラウス・レーンホフ １９８９年バイエルン国立歌劇場

programme.title: [4K]魂のタキ火「特別編 癒やしの炎６０ｍｉｎ」
programme.desc: 主役は、炎とあなたです。極上の炎と向き合い、心解きほぐす、穏やかなひとときを。異色トーク番組「魂のタキ火」から、炎、焚き火の映像のみをお送りします。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: [4K]空からクルージング特別編 クロアチア ダルマチア地方の旅[HDR]
programme.desc: アドリア海に浮かぶ街などを次々訪ね、クロアチア南部・ダルマチア地方を旅する。世界遺産トロギール、ローマ皇帝が引退後に過ごしたスプリト、そしてドブロブニクへ。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: [4K]絶景！映像散歩 夏のスイスアルプス
programme.desc: 夏のスイスアルプスの絶景をめぐる旅。高山植物が咲き乱れる高原を歩き、山岳鉄道で天空の展望台へ。名峰アイガーの北壁で岩登りに挑戦。ヨーロッパ最長の氷河を探検する！
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: [4K]驚き！地球！グレートネイチャー「大陸分裂が生んだ巨大滝」[解][字][再]
programme.desc: 落差１０００ｍのアフリカ・トゥゲラ滝、世界一の水量誇る南米イグアス滝、満月の夜に虹がみられるビクトリア滝。世界の巨大滝の神秘に迫る。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: [4K]新日本風土記 果物屋の秋[字][再]
programme.desc: 果物屋さんの店先に並ぶ梨、ぶどう、柿など色とりどりの秋の味覚。日本各地で風土と共に愛され育まれてきた果物と、大切に守り伝えてきた人々の物語。（２０２２年放送）
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: [4K]ＢＳＰ４Ｋ「八重の桜」再放送１分ＰＲ
programme.desc: 幕末の会津藩で、砲術師範の娘として会津戦争を戦った「幕末のジャンヌ・ダルク」と呼ばれる新島八重の生涯を描いた大河ドラマの再放送。魅力を１分で紹介します。

programme.title: [4K]釣りびと万歳 海底スレスレをキープせよ！褐色のオキメバル 川村卓也 新潟[字][HDR][再]
programme.desc: 新潟の海でオキメバルを狙う。この魚、目の前にエサを漂わせなければ釣ることはできない。しかし、船は絶えず移動するため釣り上げるのは至難の技。果たして釣果はいかに。

programme.title: [4K]にっぽん縦断 こころ旅 蔵出しスペシャル「２０２３年１１月 山口県」[字][再]
programme.desc: 今週の「こころ旅」は火野正平さんの「蔵出しスペシャル」！この日は２０２３年１１月、山口県の旅。懐かしの名場面と爆笑の舞台裏、未公開映像満載でお届けする２９分！
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: [4K]にっぽん縦断 こころ旅 蔵出しスペシャル「２０２３年１１月 福岡県」[字][再]
programme.desc: 今週の「こころ旅」は火野正平さんの「蔵出しスペシャル」！この日は２０２３年１１月、火野さんの秋の旅最後のゴールとなった福岡県の旅。名場面と未公開映像満載２９分！
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: [4K]大河ドラマ「べらぼう」瑣吉、春朗、貞一！心揺れる歌麿に蔦重は[字]
programme.desc: 蔦重（横浜流星）は身上半減の刑からの再起へ！滝沢瑣吉（津田健次郎）、勝川春朗（くっきー！）、重田貞一（井上芳雄）らが加わる一方、歌麿（染谷将太）の心は揺れ動く…

programme.title: [4K]ウルトラマン ４Ｋリマスター版（３３）禁じられた言葉[字][HDR][再]
programme.desc: メフィラス星人登場。フジ隊員の弟・サトルにテレパシーで語りかける謎の声。サトルを地球人の代表に選び「地球をあなたにあげます」と言わせようとするが…

programme.title: [4K]今度は４Ｋで「アストリッドとラファエル２」 毎週木曜夜９時
programme.desc: 緻密な文書係アストリッドと体当たり派の熱血警視ラファエル。正反対の２人が難事件に挑むミステリー、シーズン２を毎週木曜夜９時から、ＢＳＰ４Ｋで放送中。

programme.title: [4K]オカバンゴ ミニ[5.1][HDR]
programme.desc: 不毛の大地が一年のうち４か月だけ広大な湿原に変わるオカバンゴ。バッファローやゾウが群れで集まり、ライオンなどの肉食動物が狩りをする。命の躍動を極上の映像で描く。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: [4K]ワイルドライフ 選 ＳＰ ４Ｋ国際共同制作 プラネットアースIII 「海岸」[解][字][HDR]
programme.desc: シリーズ「プラネットアース」第３弾。今回の舞台は「海岸」。巨大な敵に挑むオットセイや神秘の生きもの、樹上の獲物を狩る魚など生きものの新たな姿を極上の映像で紹介。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: [4K]岩合光昭の世界ネコ歩きｍｉｎｉ「春のネコ」「ネコのまばたき」[字]

programme.desc: 米沢の八重（綾瀬はるか）の元へ尚之助（長谷川博己）から離縁状が届く。気丈に振る舞いながらも悲しみを抑えきれない八重。そして、それに追い打ちをかける悲劇が起きる。

programme.desc: 信長亡き世の天下を握るのは秀吉か光秀か！？本能寺の変の後に繰り広げられた激闘に迫る歴史スペシャル。本格ドラマとバーチャル技術を駆使して、両軍の戦略がよみがえる！

programme.desc: フロリダ沿岸に“黒い竜”が出現！正体は百万匹の魚の群れだ。海岸線に沿って長く伸びる魚群を襲撃するサメや巨大肉食魚！なぜ大集団は現れるのか、世界で初めて謎に迫る。

programme.desc: 世界中で愛されたファミリードラマの金字塔がよみがえる！メアリーとローラは昆虫採集にキャリーを連れていく。するとキャリーは一人でちょうを追って野原を走り出し…。

programme.desc: 身上半減から店を立て直した蔦重（横浜流星）は、てい（橋本愛）の懐妊を知り、子どもの誕生を心待ちにする。一方、城中では定信（井上祐貴）が幕閣内で孤立し始めていた。

programme.title: 完全なる報復
programme.desc: ジェラルド・バトラーとジェイミー・フォックスの2大スター競演による戦慄のクライム・サスペンス。愛する家族を奪われた男が周到で壮絶な復讐劇を仕掛ける。

programme.title: 天使のはらわた 名美 [R15+指定版]
programme.desc: 石井隆による劇画『天使のはらわた』を映画化した官能映画シリーズの第3弾。ある男性の運命を大きく動かす女性・名美役で鹿沼えりが鬼気迫る熱演を見せた。監督は田中登。

programme.title: 天使のはらわた 赤い眩暈 [R15+指定版]
programme.desc: 石井隆が自作の劇画を自身で映画化して映画監督デビュー。ヒロイン名美役を桂木麻也子、村木役を竹中直人がそれぞれ好演した官能映画シリーズ『天使のはらわた』の第5作。

programme.title: 快楽のダイアリー 優等生の欲望
programme.desc: 自分を変えるためにストリップに挑む女性の秘められた欲情とは…。『官能のダイアリー』のザルマン・キングが、ストリッパーたちの淫らな性態を赤裸々に描いた。

programme.title: 遠すぎた橋
programme.desc: ロバート・レッドフォード、ショーン・コネリーら豪華俳優陣の共演で贈る戦争巨編。連合軍が企てた大胆不敵な“マーケット・ガーデン作戦”の全貌を壮大なスケールで描く。

programme.title: リボルバー（2005）
programme.desc: ガイ・リッチー監督がジェイソン・ステイサムを主演に迎えたサスペンス・アクション。凄腕ギャンブラーが画策した復讐を軸に、裏社会に生きる人々のさまざまな思惑を描く。

programme.title: SAFE／セイフ
programme.desc: 『エクスペンダブルズ』シリーズのジェイソン・ステイサム主演のアクション。特殊な能力を持つ少女を守るため、元警官の男がマフィアや悪徳警官を相手に戦いを繰り広げる。

programme.title: ミニミニ大作戦（2003）
programme.desc: 1969年に作られた同名作をマーク・ウォールバーグ主演でリメイクしたクライム・アクション。強盗のプロフェッショナルたちが金塊を奪おうとする様をスリリングに描く。

programme.title: キラー・エリート（2011）

programme.title: 沈黙の処刑軍団
programme.desc: スティーヴン・セガールも出演したハードバイオレンス。セガール扮する大物ギャングとその縄張りを奪おうとする新興ギャング団が抗争を開始。血で血を洗う死闘が展開する。

programme.title: xikers WORLD TOUR TRICKY HOUSE : FIRST ENCOUNTER IN JAPAN
programme.desc: 韓国発の10人組ボーイズグループxikers（サイカース）。世界中を席巻するスーパールーキー初のワールドツアー日本公演を放送。

programme.title: ATEEZ SPECIAL『LOOK BACK on 5YEARS』 #1

programme.title: ATEEZ SPECIAL『LOOK BACK on 5YEARS』 #2
programme.desc: 日本デビュー5年の軌跡をメンバーインタビュー＆過去映像とともにプレイバック！熱い想いや感動のエピソードなどをWOWOWオリジナルプログラムとしてお届け。

programme.title: ATEEZ WORLD TOUR [THE FELLOWSHIP : BREAK THE WALL] ANCHOR IN JAPAN

programme.title: 沈黙の制裁
programme.desc: スティーヴン・セガールが大暴れを見せたハードアクション。ある男の暗殺を依頼された伝説の傭兵が、任務中にひとりの女性を助けたことから巨大犯罪組織に追われることに。

programme.title: チャタレイ夫人の恋人-劇場公開版-
programme.desc: ショーン・ビーンが主演し、ケン・ラッセル監督がD・H・ロレンスによるセンセーショナルな恋愛小説を映画化したエロティックドラマ。若妻はたくましい男性に魅了される。

programme.title: ラウラ・アントネッリの青い欲望
programme.desc: イタリアン・エロスの女王ラウラ・アントネッリ主演の艶笑喜劇。離婚が許されぬシチリアで、初夜に自分たちが異母兄妹だと知った夫婦が、許されぬ欲情を日々募らせて…。

programme.title: 連続ドラマW フィクサー Season3 #1〜5（全5話）
programme.desc: 日本を動かすのは、有権者か、黒幕か――。フィクサーを主人公に描く、井上由美子脚本の完全オリジナルドラマのシーズン3。

programme.title: 制服処女のいたみ [R15+指定版]
programme.desc: 当時無名の新人だった美保純が、本作でいきなり主役に抜擢されて映画デビューした官能作品。美保は新宿の歌舞伎町で遊び回る女子高生の主人公の役で天真爛漫な魅力を発揮。

programme.title: 火口のふたり [R15+指定版]
programme.desc: 荒井晴彦監督が直木賞作家・白石一文の同名小説を赤裸々なタッチで映画化して絶賛を博した濃密な人間ドラマ。柄本佑と瀧内公美が主役の男女に扮して体当たりの熱演を披露。

programme.title: 連続ドラマW 闇の伴走者 #1〜5（全5話）
programme.desc: 長崎尚志原作。元警察官の調査員と漫画編集者という異色コンビが、巨匠が遺した未発表の漫画から迷宮入り事件の真相に迫っていくクライムミステリードラマ。（全5話）

programme.title: 連続ドラマW 闇の伴走者〜編集長の条件 #1〜5（全5話）
programme.desc: 松下奈緒×古田新太のW主演コンビ再び！複雑怪奇な事件を風変わりかつユーモラスなやり取りも交えて解明してゆく、異色のヒューマンミステリー。（全5話）

programme.title: ダ・ヴィンチ・コード [エクステンデッド版] 【シリーズ3部作一挙】
programme.desc: 名画に隠されたキリスト誕生を巡る謎を、トム・ハンクス演じる頭脳明晰な大学教授が解き明かす知的ミステリー。原作はダン・ブラウンの世界的大ベストセラー小説。

programme.title: 天使と悪魔 [エクステンデッド版] 【シリーズ3部作一挙】
programme.desc: トム・ハンクス＆ロン・ハワード監督が『ダ・ヴィンチ・コード』に続きダン・ブラウン原作のベストセラーを映画化。ヴァチカンを舞台にしたミステリー・アクション。

programme.title: インフェルノ（2016） 【シリーズ3部作一挙】
programme.desc: トム・ハンクスが主演した、『ダ・ヴィンチ・コード』に始まる大人気シリーズの第3作。ラングドン教授は大富豪の陰謀を阻止しようと奔走。

programme.title: [映]ブライトン・ミラクル[字]
programme.desc: 2015年のラグビーW杯で日本代表チームが強豪南アフリカを下して<スポーツ史上最大の番狂わせ>と世界を驚愕させた、<ブライトンの奇跡>を振り返るスポーツ映画。

programme.title: [初][生]ラグビー テストマッチ 2025 南アフリカvs日本[二]
programme.desc: 19年W杯以来6年ぶりの激突!日本代表欧州遠征第1戦の相手は世界ランキング1位の南アフリカ!歴史的勝利を挙げたイングランドの地で10年ぶり2度目の勝利なるか!?

programme.desc: イアン・ランキンのベストセラー小説が原作。ジョン・リーバスは型破りなエディンバラの刑事。兄が一線を越えてしまい、ジョンは自分なりの正義を貫こうとするが…。

programme.desc: 元宙組トップスター・芹香斗亜の宝塚退団スペシャル。滋賀県のアパレルブランドを訪問し、フェアトレードで作られた商品にオリジナルデザインを入れ、刺しゅうに挑戦する。

programme.title: [初][生]LPGA女子ゴルフツアー メイバンク選手権 最終日
programme.desc: 日本勢トップは4位タイの古江彩佳。トップとは6打差と開いてしまったが、かみ合えばバーディ量産が可能なコース。7位タイの岩井明愛、11位タイの山下美夢有にも期待!

programme.title: [映]若き見知らぬ者たち[PG12][SS][字]
programme.desc: 俊英・内山拓也監督が、磯村勇斗、岸井ゆきのら人気俳優を迎えて描く商業映画デビュー作。世の理不尽に打ちのめされながらも、懸命に生きようともがく青年の葛藤を綴る。

programme.title: [映]トイレのピエタ[SS][字]

programme.title: [初]上白石萌音「Mone Kamishiraishi Special L…
programme.desc: 2026年10月5日に歌手デビュー10周年を迎える上白石萌音。10年目となる記念日に行われたミニライブ!

programme.title: 上白石萌音 “yattokosa" Tour 2024-25《kibi》
programme.desc: アルバム「kibi」をリリース、アーティストとして成長した上白石萌音のツアー「“yattokosa" Tour 2024-25《kibi》」東京公演をお届け。

programme.title: [映]泣き虫しょったんの奇跡[SS][字]
programme.desc: 将棋界の絶対的ルールを変え、35歳でサラリーマンからプロ棋士になった瀬川晶司六段の奇跡の実話を映画化した感動作。松田龍平が挫折からはい上がる主人公役を熱演。

programme.title: [映]映画「ふしぎ駄菓子屋 銭天堂」[SS][字]
programme.desc: 食べれば願いが叶うという不思議な駄菓子が並んだ「ふしぎ駄菓子屋 銭天堂」。子どもに絶大な人気を誇る児童小説シリーズを、天海祐希主演で実写映画化したファンタジー。

programme.title: 第十七回「博多・天神落語まつり」 其の壱
programme.desc: 三遊亭円楽が立ち上げた日本最大の落語フェスティバル!第17回興行の模様をお届けする。人気落語家たちが博多の街で披露する珠玉の落語をご堪能あれ。

programme.title: [初][映]【推しの子】‐The Final Act‐[SS][字]
programme.desc: 赤坂アカと横槍メンゴによる大ヒットコミックを、櫻井海音主演で実写化した連続ドラマの劇場版完結編。主人公アクアは、ついに母アイの命を奪った“真犯人"と対峙する。

programme.title: [映]キングスマン(字幕版)[R15+][SS]
programme.desc: C・ファースらをキャストを迎え、「キック・アス」の鬼才M・ヴォーン監督が挑んだスパイアクションシリーズ第1作。スパイ組織“キングスマン"は世界征服の陰謀に挑む。

programme.title: [無][初]映画『WIND BREAKER/ウィ…』徹底解剖ナビ キャラクター篇
[映]ドリーム・シナリオ(字幕版)[SS]
programme.desc: 人気男優N・ケイジが主演し、米国“A24"社のもと、鬼才A・アスター監督らが製作した不条理サスペンスコメディ。ある大学教授は何百万人もの夢に登場するように……?

programme.title: [映]勇敢な市民(字幕版)[PG12][SS]
programme.desc: 韓国の人気WEBコミックを実写映画化したアクションコメディ。元女子ボクシング選手でもある非正規教員の主人公が、学園を暴力で支配する有力者の息子に立ち向かう。

programme.title: [映]フォー・レター・ワーズ(字幕版)
programme.desc: 「ANORA アノーラ」が第97回アカデミー賞で作品賞ほかに輝いた鬼才S・ベイカーの監督デビュー作。ある真夏の夜、米国の郊外で男子大学生たちは本音をぶつけ合う。

programme.title: [映]ジャッカル(字幕版)
programme.desc: B・ウィリスとR・ギアが豪華共演。伝説の殺し屋と元IRAの闘士が息詰まる駆け引きを展開する。名作「ジャッカルの日」を現代によみがえらせたサスペンスアクション。

programme.title: [映]ミッキー17(字幕版)[SS]
programme.desc: 「パラサイト 半地下の家族」が第92回アカデミー賞で4部門を制した韓国のポン・ジュノ監督が、ハリウッドのスタッフ・俳優陣と組んだ話題のSFエンターテインメント。

programme.title: [無][初]映画『WIND BREAKER/ウィ…』徹底解剖ナビ ストーリー篇
[映]雨鱒の川[字]
programme.desc: 玉木宏と綾瀬はるかが共演した感動作。絵を描く才能を持った少年と、彼とだけは互いに心を通じ合える耳の不自由な少女。そんな2人は、成人した後も純愛を貫こうとし……。

programme.title: [映]僕の彼女はサイボーグ[SS][字]
programme.desc: 人気俳優、綾瀬はるかの魅力をたっぷりと楽しめるラブファンタジーの快作。冴えない青年の前に現われた美女は、未来からやって来たアンドロイド(人間型ロボット)だった。

programme.title: [映]映画 ホタルノヒカリ[SS][字]
programme.desc: 綾瀬はるか主演の人気TVドラマの劇場版。“干物女"と“ぶちょお"がついにゴールイン。だが新婚旅行先のイタリア・ローマで、2人の行く先々にトラブルが発生し?

programme.title: [映]劇場版 奥様は、取り扱い注意[SS][字]
programme.desc: 綾瀬はるかと西島秀俊が主演したヒットアクションドラマ「奥様は、取り扱い注意」を映画化。元特殊工作員の妻・菜美とその夫・勇輝、2人のスケールアップした激闘を描く。

programme.title: [初][映]ルート29[SS][字]
programme.desc: 綾瀬はるかが主演した、新感覚ロードムービー。孤独な女性は風変わりな少女を連れ、車で国道29号線を姫路から鳥取まで旅する。監督は「こちらあみ子」の新鋭、森井勇佑。

programme.title: [映]キングスマン:ゴールデン・サークル(字幕版)[PG12][SS]
programme.desc: 一見時代遅れのようでいて、実は超凄腕であるスパイ組織の活躍を描いた、大ヒット痛快アクション「キングスマン」シリーズの第2作。前作に続いてC・ファースらが共演。

programme.title: [映]エア・ロック 海底緊急避難所(字幕版)[SS]
programme.desc: 墜落し、海底に沈んだ旅客機を舞台に、水圧や酸素残量、そして機体の穴から侵入する人食いザメの襲撃におびえる生存者たちのサバイバルを描くパニックホラーサスペンス。

programme.title: [映]疾風ロンド[SS][字]
programme.desc: 阿部寛、大倉忠義、大島優子らの息の合った掛け合いに笑いを誘われる、コメディ風サスペンス。盗まれた生物兵器を捜す主任研究員が、スキー場で騒動を巻き起こすことに。

programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history, and culture. This episode looks at words related to mud. Explore the unique culture behind them.
Peter MacMillan, a poet and a literary translator, presents various Japanese words and expressions related to mud.

The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode focuses on words related to doro, or mud. Since ancient times, Japanese people have gotten muddy in the rice paddies, cultivating their main staple. Perhaps because of this, there are a surprising number of expressions related to mud in Japanese. And reflecting such a place of hard work, many of them are used in business situations. From his home in Kyoto Prefecture, poet and literary translator Peter MacMillan guides us through unique words born from "mud."

Seasoning the Seasons
programme.desc: This program visits places across Japan to introduce the charms of their local daily life and festivals fostered by the nation's long history.

Visiting different places across Japan to introduce the viewer to the charms of local daily life and festivals fostered by the nation's long history. This time, highlighting the history behind Japan's bridges.

Traveling across Japan, we can find many bridges of all shapes and sizes. In Tokyo, building modern bridges was one way to join the club of advanced industrial nations in the late 19th century, when Japan was vying to catch up with Western technology. A small bridge in Iwate Prefecture is hand-made. Even if relatively few people use it, it is an important crossing for the local community. Today, we hear the story of bridges linking communities throughout Japan.

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Adults play the role of the shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects.

Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Here, the shishi symbolizes the harshness and bounty of the natural world, and the matsuri focuses on the importance of harmony between people and nature. Adults play the role of the enormous shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects. This event is also an opportunity for local families to wish for happy marriages and children, and the shishi dances in celebration.

programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history, and culture. This episode looks at words related to mud. Explore the unique culture behind them.
Peter MacMillan, a poet and a literary translator, presents various Japanese words and expressions related to mud.

The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode focuses on words related to doro, or mud. Since ancient times, Japanese people have gotten muddy in the rice paddies, cultivating their main staple. Perhaps because of this, there are a surprising number of expressions related to mud in Japanese. And reflecting such a place of hard work, many of them are used in business situations. From his home in Kyoto Prefecture, poet and literary translator Peter MacMillan guides us through unique words born from "mud."

Renowned pianist Lee Kyung-mi uses her talent to foster better ties between Japan and South Korea. We trace her journey, from childhood to sharing the stage with special friends in 2025 in Seoul.
programme.title: The Musical Diplomat: Playing a Bridge for Two Countries
programme.desc: Renowned pianist Lee Kyung-mi uses her talent to foster better ties between Japan and South Korea.

programme.title: Seasoning the Seasons
programme.desc: This program visits places across Japan to introduce the charms of their local daily life and festivals fostered by the nation's long history.

Visiting different places across Japan to introduce the viewer to the charms of local daily life and festivals fostered by the nation's long history. This time, highlighting the history behind Japan's bridges.

Traveling across Japan, we can find many bridges of all shapes and sizes. In Tokyo, building modern bridges was one way to join the club of advanced industrial nations in the late 19th century, when Japan was vying to catch up with Western technology. A small bridge in Iwate Prefecture is hand-made. Even if relatively few people use it, it is an important crossing for the local community. Today, we hear the story of bridges linking communities throughout Japan.

programme.title: Herbal Symphony
programme.desc: In Uda, discover Japan's oldest private medicinal herb garden, where the natural landscape from 300 years ago is preserved in a botanical time capsule, a sanctuary of the local culture and history.
Japan's oldest private herb garden in Uda, Nara Prefecture has a 300-year history. To pass this legacy into the future, knowledge of medicinal herbs is shared with younger generations.
programme.title: Herbal Symphony #5

programme.title: 【プレミアムドラマ】「終活シェアハウス」
Premium Drama "End-of-life Planning Shared House"
End-of-life Planning Shared House
programme.desc: In a shared house on the outskirts of Tokyo, three lifelong friends live together, led by culinary expert Utako (Takeshita Keiko). One day, university student Hayami Shota (Jo Kairi) is invited to be Utako's secretary, sparking a lively exchange between generations. Later, their old friend Tsuneko (Ichige Yoshie), who shows signs of Mild Cognitive Impairment, joins them, throwing things into a bit of chaos. They also begin to confront the real-life challenges of senior living. The drama, with warmth and quiet resolve, asks a timeless question: What does it mean to live?
programme.title: End-Of-Life Planning..., Ep 1
programme.desc: Three old friends live together on the outskirts of Tokyo, led by culinary expert Utako. Their lives change when university student Hayami Shota becomes Utako’s secretary. The arrival of Tsuneko, who shows signs of memory loss, brings both warmth and a bit of chaos to the house.
programme.title: End-Of-Life Planning..., Ep 1
programme.desc: Tiga sahabat lama hidup bersama di pinggiran Tokyo di bawah pimpinan ahli kuliner Utako. Kehidupan mereka berubah saat mahasiswa Hayami Shota menjadi sekretaris Utako. Kedatangan Tsuneko yang mengalami gangguan ingatan ringan menambah kehangatan sekaligus kekacauan di rumah itu

programme.title: ウルトラ重機大図鑑
Ultra Heavy Machinery 5min.
Ultra Heavy Machinery
programme.desc: The program brings you the unknown world of heavy machineries around the world. In this episode, heavy machinery specialized for specific tasks appear in various parts of Japan.
The world loves Japan's heavy machinery. We explore the secrets of its popularity and learn about items ranging from small excavators to cranes that erect skyscrapers in cramped urban spaces.
programme.title: Ultra Heavy Machinery
浮世絵EDO-LIFE
Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE
programme.desc: Let's look into the world of Ukiyoe to learn how people lived in Edo period!

Centuries ago, Tokyo was known as Edo. More than a million people enjoyed life in this small but abundant city. They live on in ukiyo-e woodblock prints. Each episode is a deep dive into a single print, and an exploration of the soul of Old Tokyo. We examine works by artists like Hokusai and Hiroshige not just for their aesthetic and historical value, but for the stories they tell of everyday life. That is how the people of Edo themselves enjoyed this mass-produced medium.
programme.title: Ukiyoe Edo-Life

Historical Drama "UNBOUND"
UNBOUND
programme.desc: Tsutaju manages to recover his business with Utamaro's upper-body portrait series 'Fujin Sogaku Juttai.' As the new year begins, he rebuilds his shop after losing half his fortune. Furthermore, Utamaro's latest nishikie, portraying Edo's poster girls, becomes a huge hit, breathing new life into the town and drawing crowds to the shops. Amidst this renewed bustle, Tei tells Tsutaju she's pregnant. Meanwhile, Sadanobu begins to lose support within the shogunate due to his hardline stance on foreign and imperial matters.
programme.title: Unbound, Ep 42
programme.desc: Harumachi takes his own life, and Kisanji departs. As Tsutaju's trusted writers leave one after another, he turns to Masanobu with a request to write

programme.desc: Harumachi bunuh diri, dan Kisanji pergi. Seiring dengan kepergian para penulis tepercaya Tsutaju satu per satu, ia meminta Masanobu untuk menulis.

programme.title: 浮世絵EDO-LIFE
Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE
programme.desc: Centuries ago, Tokyo was known as Edo. More than a million people enjoyed life in this small but abundant city. They live on in ukiyo-e woodblock prints. Each episode is a deep dive into a single print, and an exploration of the soul of Old Tokyo. We examine works by artists like Hokusai and Hiroshige not just for their aesthetic and historical value, but for the stories they tell of everyday life. That is how the people of Edo themselves enjoyed this mass-produced medium.
programme.title: Ukiyoe Edo-Life

MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Here, the shishi symbolizes the harshness and bounty of the natural world, and the matsuri focuses on the importance of harmony between people and nature. Adults play the role of the enormous shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects. This event is also an opportunity for local families to wish for happy marriages and children, and the shishi dances in celebration.

programme.title: Journeys in Japan
programme.sub-title: SILK Road: Threads of History from Gunma to Yokohama
programme.desc: In 1859, when Japan reopened its doors after more than two centuries of isolation, goods flowed in and out of newly expanded ports. At the time, raw silk became the country's largest export, as the silk industries in France and Italy had been hit by an epidemic of silkworm disease. At one point, Japan was the world's biggest exporter. On this episode of Journeys in Japan, Sheila Cliffe from the UK follows the Silk Road from northern Kanto, once a major production area, to Yokohama, where the silk took off to the world.

programme.title: Trails to Oishii Tokyo
programme.desc: Okra has only been widely eaten in Japan for about 60 years, yet new, stickier varieties keep appearing to suit Japanese tastes. Explore the vegetable's charm through a variety of unique dishes. Reporter: Janni Olsson

programme.title: Asia Insight
programme.sub-title: The Hui: Muslim Merchants Thriving in China
programme.desc: In Yiwu, China, the Muslim Hui people expand trade with Arab countries using their Arabic language skills. They are becoming an essential presence as China shifts away from US trade and diversifies.

programme.title: Nun's Cookbook
programme.desc: The temple chefs show us how to make su-no-mono with dried daikon radish. Just mix rehydrated daikon with red radish and sweet vinegar, and this tasty pink-colored dish is ready to serve.

programme.title: Where We Call Home
programme.sub-title: Happiness Crafted with Needle and Thread
programme.desc: We meet two crafters of bespoke fashion in Tokyo - German Melanie Uematsu whose specialties include wedding gowns for non-Japanese customers, and Australian Thom O’Brien who creates handmade hats.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Herbal Symphony
programme.desc: Autumn in Japan's oldest private medicinal herb garden in Uda, Nara Prefecture. As the plants bear fruit, the garden's custodians protect the seeds, ensuring that they live on for future generations.

programme.title: Time-lapse Journey
programme.desc: Kyoto in the autumn: the old capital is even more beautiful when dressed in fall colors. Witness the contemplative and quiet beauty of Kyoto through time-lapse photography.

programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode focuses on words related to doro, or mud. Since ancient times, Japanese people have gotten muddy in the rice paddies, cultivating their main staple. Perhaps because of this, there are a surprising number of expressions related to mud in Japanese. And reflecting such a place of hard work, many of them are used in business situations. From his home in Kyoto Prefecture, poet and literary translator Peter MacMillan guides us through unique words born from "mud."

programme.title: Easy Japanese
programme.desc: Learn how to say where you're from. The formula is the name of the place, followed by "kara kimashita".

programme.title: Culture Crossroads
programme.desc: In Edogawa City, where 40% of Tokyo's Indian population resides, a cultural exchange program gives Japanese residents the chance to visit Indian homes as well as facilities run by Indians.

programme.title: HELLO! NHK WORLD-JAPAN
programme.desc: Cycle Around Japan has teamed up with Taiwan's public broadcaster, PTS, for a three-part series airing this fall. Experience Taiwan's lush scenery, and meet guardians of traditional culture.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: A week into the new year, giant torches are lit in a shrine precinct. The shadows they create enable a demon-oni-to go to a river and cleanse people of troubles. This is Oniyo: the night of the oni.

programme.title: The Masterpieces of Ukiyo-e producer Tsutaju
programme.sub-title: The Actor Otani Oniji III as Edobei
programme.desc: This miniseries presents the masterpieces of Tsutaju, a brilliant ukiyo-e producer of the Edo period. This episode spotlights artist Sharaku's debut work "The Actor Otani Oniji III as Edobei."

programme.title: Hometown Stories
programme.sub-title: Chasing a Dream With a Horse
programme.desc: Nishino Masatoshi didn't know what he wanted to do with his life until he learned about horse logging. Now, he's chasing his dream in the forests of Hokkaido with the help of his trusty sidekick, Kap.

programme.title: Satoyama Kitchen Summer #5
programme.sub-title: Hot Days and Cool Nights Make Tasty Veggies
programme.desc: At the Satoyama Kitchen guesthouse in Hida Takayama, chef Nobuko, her cameraman husband Makoto and their cat Tama take us on a tasty journey of local cuisine served with a side of seasonal scenery.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE

programme.title: Herbal Symphony #5
programme.desc: In Uda, discover Japan's oldest private medicinal herb garden, where the natural landscape from 300 years ago is preserved in a botanical time capsule, a sanctuary of the local culture and history.

programme.title: YONEZAWA: Shirabu Onsen
programme.desc: A 700-year-old hot spring, Shirabu Onsen, is maintained via daily trips up the slopes of the 2,000-meter mountain where it sits. See the hot spring's guardian at work, in gorgeous time-lapse footage.

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Here, the shishi symbolizes the harshness and bounty of the natural world, and the matsuri focuses on the importance of harmony between people and nature. Adults play the role of the enormous shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects. This event is also an opportunity for local families to wish for happy marriages and children, and the shishi dances in celebration.

programme.title: BOSAI: Science that Can Save Your Life
programme.desc: The Great East Japan Earthquake in 2011 and its resulting tsunami caused the accident at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant. The worst nuclear accident in Japan's history suffered from a lack of information due to the inaccessibility of the reactor buildings. For this reason, "disaster response robots" were deployed to take pictures and measure radiation doses inside the buildings. In the aftermath of a major disaster like that as well as an earthquake or fire, robots can quickly enter dangerous sites that are inaccessible to humans, find people in need of rescue, and take detailed measurements to provide data about the site. In this episode, we'll look at the latest developments among Japan's "disaster response robots."

programme.desc: NEWSROOM TOKYO dives deeper into the day's news with insight and analysis, from the perspective of Japan and the rest of Asia. We put a spotlight on what you need to know to understand the issues.

programme.title: Dining with the Chef
programme.sub-title: Rika's Tokyo Cuisine:Beef Tataki/ Udon with Shiso Sauce
programme.desc: Chef Rika's Beef Tataki is inspired by Kochi's beloved Katsuo no Tataki, seared bonito with vegetables. She recreates it with wagyu beef and chilled udon in a refreshing Japanese herb sauce.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Document 72 Hours
programme.sub-title: A Mobile "Warabi Mochi" Cart in Fukuoka
programme.desc: A mobile food cart selling a traditional Japanese sweet has been plying the streets of Fukuoka for over 75 years. For three days, we talked to customers fond of a snack unchanged over the decades.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Science View
programme.sub-title: Special Episode: Shining Hope for Myotonic Dystrophy -A New Drug Discovery
programme.desc: There is a doctor who is working to develop drugs to treat myotonic dystrophy, an incurable disease. We take a closer look at Professor Masayuki NAKAMORI of Yamaguchi University and his challenge.

programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history, and culture. This episode looks at words related to shadow or shade. Explore the unique culture behind them.

programme.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: In September, 11 districts in Yatsuo in Toyama Prefecture parade along different routes performing Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon, a 300-year-old matsuri that features elegant music, dancing, and singing.

programme.title: On the Wings 5min.
programme.desc: Join us on a night flight to admire Japan's stunning views on a journey from Tokyo to Fukuoka - behold the sublime beauty of Mount Fuji at sunset and the sparkling night views of major cities.

programme.title: Let's Enjoy Maths
programme.desc: Children wish to share a cake but are confused when Numbler cuts the cake into different shapes - Barky uses the basics of fractions and geometry to prove that the pieces are indeed equal.

programme.title: Take Tech
programme.desc: A programme for upper primary to lower secondary school children about exploring everyday technologies all around them - each episode takes a piece of familiar tech and finds out what it does and how.

programme.title: Japanology Plus mini
programme.desc: There are about 900 service areas along Japan's expressways - some feature aquariums, amusement parks, or hot spring baths as they continue to evolve and fulfil a growing variety of functions.

programme.title: Bosai: Science That Can Save...
programme.desc: Disaster Response Robots: If disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people if fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents prevent smooth recovery - that's where disaster response robots can help.

programme.title: History of a Traditional Fabric
programme.desc: Yamanashi / Shibata Fumie (Product Designer): Kaiki is a thin and brightly coloured silk fabric - Fumie discovers how threads are arranged to produce a layered effect that resembles a digital image.

programme.desc: Japan's plastic models are popular worldwide - Shizuoka City leads the nation in plastic model shipments. We look at the city's plastic model industry, from its history to the latest developments.
